enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reception immediately stops and transmission stops after a bad CRC is appended to any currently transmitted frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MAC is enabled, and reception and transmission are possible

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Magic detection logic disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The MAC core detects magic packets and asserts EIR[WAKEUP] when a frame is detected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operating mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Sleep mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Legacy FEC buffer descriptors and functions enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enhanced frame time-stamping functions enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: MAC continues operation in debug mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MAC enters hardware freeze mode when the processor is in debug mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Write frame operation, but not MII compliant

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Write frame operation for a valid MII management frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Read frame operation for a valid MII management frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Read frame operation, but not MII compliant

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Preamble enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Preamble (32 ones) is not prepended to the MII management frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: 1 internal module clock cycle

enumeratedValue.name: 0b001
enumeratedValue.description: 2 internal module clock cycles

enumeratedValue.name: 0b010
enumeratedValue.description: 3 internal module clock cycles

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111
enumeratedValue.description: 8 internal module clock cycles

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitted frames are looped back internal to the device and transmit MII output signals are not asserted. DRT must be cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive path operates independently of transmit. Used for full-duplex or to monitor transmit activity in half-duplex mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Disable reception of frames while transmitting. Normally used for half-duplex mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MII or RMII mode, as indicated by the RMII_MODE bit

field.name: PROM
field.description: Promiscuous mode. All frames are accepted regardless of address matching

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: MAC configured for MII mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MAC configured for RMII operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: 100 Mbps operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: 10 Mbps operation

field.name: PADEN
field.description: Enable Frame Padding Remove On Receive

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No padding is removed on receive by the MAC

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Padding is removed from received frames

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Pause frames are terminated and discarded in the MAC

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Pause frames are forwarded to the user application

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The CRC field of received frames is transmitted to the user application

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The CRC field is stripped from the frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: MAC control frames with any opcode other than 0x0001 (pause frame) are accepted and forwarded to the client interface

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MAC control frames with any opcode other than 0x0001 (pause frame) are silently discarded

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The payload length check is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The core checks the frame's payload length with the frame length/type field. Errors are indicated in the EIR[PLC] field

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No PAUSE frame transmitted

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The MAC stops transmission of data frames after the current transmission is complete

field.name: ADDSEL
field.description: Source MAC Address Select On Transmit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: Node MAC address programmed on PADDR1/2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b100
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b101
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b110
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The source MAC address is not modified by the MAC

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The MAC overwrites the source MAC address with the programmed MAC address according to ADDSEL

field.name: CRCFWD
field.description: Forward Frame From Application With CRC

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TxBD[TC] controls whether the frame has a CRC from the application

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter does not append any CRC to transmitted frames as it is expecting a frame with CRC from the application

field.name: PADDR2
field.description: Bytes 4 (bits 31:24) and 5 (bits 23:16) of the 6-byte individual address used for exact match, and the source address field in PAUSE frames

field.name: IADDR1
field.description: The upper 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a unicast address. Bit 31 of IADDR1 contains hash index bit 63. Bit 0 of IADDR1 contains hash index bit 32

field.name: IADDR2
field.description: The lower 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a unicast address. Bit 31 of IADDR2 contains hash index bit 31. Bit 0 of IADDR2 contains hash index bit 0

field.name: GADDR1
field.description: Contains the upper 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a multicast address. Bit 31 of GADDR1 contains hash index bit 63. Bit 0 of GADDR1 contains hash index bit 32

field.name: GADDR2
field.description: Contains the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a multicast address. Bit 31 of GADDR2 contains hash index bit 31. Bit 0 of GADDR2 contains hash index bit 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000000
enumeratedValue.description: 64 bytes written

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000001
enumeratedValue.description: 64 bytes written

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000010
enumeratedValue.description: 128 bytes written

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000011
enumeratedValue.description: 192 bytes written

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111111
enumeratedValue.description: 4032 bytes written

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled, the transmission start threshold is programmed in TFWR

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled

field.name: R_DES_START
field.description: Pointer to the start of the receive buffer descriptor queue

register.name: TDSR
register.description: Transmit Buffer Descriptor Ring Start Register

field.name: X_DES_START
field.description: Pointer to the start of the transmit buffer descriptor queue

field.name: RX_SECTION_FULL
field.description: Value Of Receive FIFO Section Full Threshold

field.name: RX_SECTION_EMPTY
field.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Section Empty Threshold

field.name: STAT_SECTION_EMPTY
field.description: RX Status FIFO Section Empty Threshold

field.name: RX_ALMOST_EMPTY
field.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

field.name: RX_ALMOST_FULL
field.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Full Threshold

field.name: TX_SECTION_EMPTY
field.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Section Empty Threshold

field.name: TX_ALMOST_EMPTY
field.description: Value of Transmit FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

field.name: TX_ALMOST_FULL
field.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Almost Full Threshold

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates to the transmit data FIFO that the written frames contain two additional octets before the frame data. This means the actual frame begins at bit 16 of the first word written into the FIFO. This function allows putting the frame payload on a 32-bit boundary in memory, as the 14-byte Ethernet header is extended to a 16-byte header

field.name: IPCHK
field.description: Enables insertion of IP header checksum

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Checksum is not inserted

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: If an IP frame is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically. The IP header checksum field must be cleared. If a non-IP frame is transmitted the frame is not modified

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Checksum not inserted

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: If an IP frame with a known protocol is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically into the frame. The checksum field must be cleared. The other frames are not modified

field.name: PADREM
field.description: Enable Padding Removal For Short IP Frames

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Padding not removed

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Any bytes following the IP payload section of the frame are removed from the frame

field.name: IPDIS
field.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong IPv4 Header Checksum

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Frames with wrong IPv4 header checksum are not discarded

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: If an IPv4 frame is received with a mismatching header checksum, the frame is discarded. IPv6 has no header checksum and is not affected by this setting. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared)

field.name: PRODIS
field.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong Protocol Checksum

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Frames with wrong checksum are not discarded

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: If a TCP/IP, UDP/IP, or ICMP/IP frame is received that has a wrong TCP, UDP, or ICMP checksum, the frame is discarded. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared)

field.name: LINEDIS
field.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With MAC Layer Errors

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Frames with errors are not discarded

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Any frame received with a CRC, length, or PHY error is automatically discarded and not forwarded to the user application interface

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Instructs the MAC to write two additional bytes in front of each frame received into the RX FIFO

register.name: RMON_T_DROP
register.description: Count of frames not counted correctly (RMON_T_DROP). NOTE: Counter not implemented (read 0 always) as not applicable

register.name: RMON_T_CRC_ALIGN
register.description: RMON Tx Packets w CRC/Align error (RMON_T_CRC_ALIGN)

register.name: RMON_T_UNDERSIZE
register.description: RMON Tx Packets < 64 bytes, good CRC (RMON_T_UNDERSIZE)

register.name: RMON_T_OVERSIZE
register.description: RMON Tx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, good CRC (RMON_T_OVERSIZE)

register.name: RMON_T_FRAG
register.description: RMON Tx Packets < 64 bytes, bad CRC (RMON_T_FRAG)

register.name: RMON_T_JAB
register.description: RMON Tx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, bad CRC (RMON_T_JAB)

register.name: IEEE_T_DROP
register.description: Count of frames not counted correctly (IEEE_T_DROP). NOTE: Counter not implemented (read 0 always) as not applicable

register.name: IEEE_T_MACERR
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Tx FIFO Underrun (IEEE_T_MACERR)

register.name: IEEE_T_CSERR
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Carrier Sense Error (IEEE_T_CSERR)

register.name: IEEE_T_SQE
register.description: Frames Transmitted with SQE Error (IEEE_T_SQE). NOTE: Counter not implemented (read 0 always) as no SQE information is available

register.name: IEEE_T_OCTETS_OK
register.description: Octet count for Frames Transmitted w/o Error (IEEE_T_OCTETS_OK). NOTE: Counts total octets (includes header and FCS fields)

register.name: RMON_R_CRC_ALIGN
register.description: RMON Rx Packets w CRC/Align error (RMON_R_CRC_ALIGN)

register.name: RMON_R_UNDERSIZE
register.description: RMON Rx Packets < 64 bytes, good CRC (RMON_R_UNDERSIZE)

register.name: RMON_R_OVERSIZE
register.description: RMON Rx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, good CRC (RMON_R_OVERSIZE)

register.name: RMON_R_FRAG
register.description: RMON Rx Packets < 64 bytes, bad CRC (RMON_R_FRAG)

register.name: RMON_R_JAB
register.description: RMON Rx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, bad CRC (RMON_R_JAB)

register.name: IEEE_R_DROP
register.description: Count of frames not counted correctly (IEEE_R_DROP). NOTE: Counter increments if a frame with valid/missing SFD character is detected and has been dropped. None of the other counters increments if this counter increments

register.name: IEEE_R_OCTETS_OK
register.description: Octet count for Frames Rcvd w/o Error (IEEE_R_OCTETS_OK). Counts total octets (includes header and FCS fields)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The timer stops at the current value

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The timer starts incrementing

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The timer can be reset to zero when the given offset time is reached (offset event). The field is cleared when the offset event is reached, so no further event occurs until the field is set again. The timer offset value must be set before setting this field

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The timer is not affected and no action occurs, besides clearing OFFEN, when the offset is reached

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: If OFFEN is set, the timer resets to zero when the offset setting is reached. The offset event does not cause a timer interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A period event interrupt can be generated (EIR[TS_TIMER]) and the event signal output is asserted when the timer wraps around according to the periodic setting ATPER. The timer period value must be set before setting this bit. Not all devices contain the event signal output. See the chip configuration details

field.name: PINPER
field.description: Enables event signal output assertion on period event. Not all devices contain the event signal output. See the Chip Configuration details

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The current time is captured and can be read from the ATVR register

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The timer is active and all configuration fields in this register are relevant

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The internal timer is disabled and the externally provided timer value is used. All other fields, except CAPTURE, in this register have no effect. CAPTURE can still be used to capture the current timer value

field.name: ATIME
field.description: A write sets the timer. A read returns the last captured value. To read the current value, issue a capture command (set ATCR[CAPTURE]) prior to reading this register

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Offset value for one-shot event generation. When the timer reaches the value an event can be generated to reset the counter. If the increment value in ATINC is given in true nanoseconds, this value is also given in true nanoseconds

field.name: PERIOD
field.description: Value for generating periodic events. Each instance the timer reaches this value, the period event occurs and the timer restarts. If the increment value in ATINC is given in true nanoseconds, this value is also given in true nanoseconds. The value should be initialized to 1,000,000,000 (1 x 10 9 ) to represent a timer wrap around of one second. The increment value set in ATINC should be set to the true nanoseconds of the period of clock ts_clk, hence implementing a true 1 second counter

field.name: INC
field.description: Clock Period Of The Timestamping Clock (ts_clk) In Nanoseconds

field.name: TIMESTAMP
field.description: Timestamp of the last frame transmitted by the core that had TxBD[TS] set . This register is only valid when EIR[TS_AVAIL] is set

field.name: TF0
field.description: Copy of Timer Flag for channel 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 0 is clear

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 0 is set

field.name: TF1
field.description: Copy of Timer Flag for channel 1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 1 is clear

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 1 is set

field.name: TF2
field.description: Copy of Timer Flag for channel 2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 2 is clear

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 2 is set

field.name: TF3
field.description: Copy of Timer Flag for channel 3

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 3 is clear

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 3 is set

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: DMA request is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA request is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0000
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0001
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on rising edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0010
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0011
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on both edges

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0100
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - software only

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0101
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - toggle output on compare

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0110
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0111
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1000
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1010
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare, set output on overflow

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10x1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare, clear output on overflow

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1100
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1110
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output low on compare for one 1588 clock cycle

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1111
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output high on compare for one 1588 clock cycle

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has not occurred

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has occurred

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: DMA request is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA request is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0000
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0001
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on rising edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0010
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0100

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0111

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1000
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1010
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare, set output on overflow

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10x1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare, clear output on overflow

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1100
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1110
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output low on compare for one 1588 clock cycle

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1111
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output high on compare for one 1588 clock cycle

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has not occurred

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1100
